The Obligatory Bouncing Balls Sketch

29 September 2010

Never let it be said that I didn't create a processing sketch where a ball bounced around the screen.

This is a little step forward with objects; in this case each “ball” represents an object which is being moved around the screen by a loop. Clicking the mouse anywhere on the screen creates a new ball. Pressing any key on the keyboard “kills” the circles currently on the screen (but doesn't actually destroy them). Groundbreaking stuff.

Feel free to download the sketch file.

Update: Fixed a few bugs; new sketch is here. Still by no means clever or finished.
